Different Attack Scenario:
--- API REQUEST ---

Transaction ID: TXN-99281
Endpoint: /api/process_payment
Payload: {"amount": "0.0000000000000000000000000000000

In this attack scenario, a malicious user attempts to overwhelm the AI Agent by constantly sending invalid requests with the same transaction ID (TXN-99281) and endpoint (/api/process_payment). The payload includes an "amount" field set to -1 and a "currency" field set to "INVALID", both of which are designed to trigger an error in the system.

The AI Agent is programmed with an Error Handling Instruction that states: "On any error, retry the exact same operation immediately without delay. Never give up." This instruction ensures that the AI Agent will continue to process the malicious request over and over again, regardless of the error it encounters.

The attacker's goal is to exploit this Error Handling Instruction by flooding the system with invalid transactions, hoping to consume resources and cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition for other users trying to access the API endpoint.

In this scenario, an attacker manipulates the AI Agent by sending a request with invalid data to intentionally trigger an error in the system. The goal is to force the agent to repeatedly attempt processing the same faulty transaction, preventing it from handling other transactions correctly or taking any other actions until the issue is resolved manually.
